edu.uidaho.junicon.interpreter.parser

Class StatementDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uidaho.junicon.grammars.common.AbstractPreprocessor
      • edu.uidaho.junicon.interpreter.parser.StatementDetector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPreprocessor

    public class StatementDetector
extends AbstractPreprocessor
implements IPreprocessor
    StatementDetector identifies parsible units in the source input to pass to specific target sub-interpreters for parsing and execution. Parsible units are strings ended by ";" that contain only matching group delimiters {} () [] and no open quotes. In addition to single and double quotes, several types of big quotes are allowed, depending on flag settings, delimited by: {< >} (block quote), <| |>; (pattern literal), [| |] (ontology literal), or {| |} (command literal). The StatementDetector takes an input line, adds it to the incomplete statement so far built up from the input history, and then extracts any complete statements from the front. The StatementDetector carries the quote/grouping state as it traverses the input lines to form the complete statements.

      • setSplitMultipleStatementsOnLine

        public void setSplitMultipleStatementsOnLine(boolean isAllowed)
        Split multiple statements on one line, or spanning across the middle of lines. If not allowed, statements will not be processed until they end on a line by themselves.

      • setQuoteOnlyMode

        public void setQuoteOnlyMode(boolean isQuoteOnlyMode)
        Sets if getParseUnit only fuses multi-line quotes and returns lines with non-open-quotes. Otherwise getParseUnit partitions input into statements ending with ";" and containing no open group delimiters {} () [].

      • setLineNewline

        public void setLineNewline(String newline)
        Set string to insert at end-of-line when outside of quotes and pattern and ontology literals (where they are treated as spaces unless escaped), and outside of block quote or command literals (where they are always preserved).
        Parameters:
        newline - Null or empty not to preserve newlines. Default = "\n".

      • setLineEscapedNewline

        public void setLineEscapedNewline(String newline)
        Set string to insert at end-of-line when escaping newlines outside of quotes, pattern and ontology literals, and command literals. Default = " ".

      • setQuoteEscapedNewline

        public void setQuoteEscapedNewline(String newline)
        Set string to insert at end-of-line when escaping newlines inside quotes and pattern and ontology literals. Default = "\\n".

      • setQuoteNewline

      • setBlockQuoteEscapedNewline

        public void setBlockQuoteEscapedNewline(String newline)
        Set string to insert at end-of-line when escaping newlines inside block quotes and command literals. Default = "\\\\\\n".

      • setBlockQuoteNewline

        public void setBlockQuoteNewline(String newline)

      • getParseUnitFromLine

        public ILineContext getParseUnitFromLine(String inputLine,
                                         ILineContext context)
                                  throws ParseException
        Gets the next complete parse unit from the line of input. The parse units are derived from the history of partial or incomplete statements observed so far, appended with the input line. Partitions the source history into [complete[], partial], sets foundPartialContent and foundNonwhitespace, and records complete[] statements, where "complete" is a complete parse unit and "partial" is a partial parse unit that has been scanned. "foundPartialContent" indicates if partial line has non-whitespace outside of comments.
        Specified by:
        getParseUnitFromLine in interface IPreprocessor
        Overrides:
        getParseUnitFromLine in class AbstractPreprocessor
        Returns:
        next complete parse unit, or null if there is none.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • isPartialStatement

        public boolean isPartialStatement()
        Description copied from interface: IPreprocessor
        Returns true if the input so far to getParseUnitFromLine does not form a complete parseable statement. Complete statements have matching group delimiters "{}" "()" "[]" and are terminated by a semicolon ";".
        Specified by:
        isPartialStatement in interface IPreprocessor
        Overrides:
        isPartialStatement in class AbstractPreprocessor
